sentences.english: Assign 2 hours to shipowner to control the vessel when on trial.
sentences.chinese: 在试航过程中，须分配两小时给船东作自作操控。

sentences.english: The Chinese navy's first aircraft carrier has begun its sea trials, the state-run Xinhua news agency has said.
sentences.chinese: 中国新华社称，中国海军首艘航空母舰已经开始试航。

sentences.english: He took part in an attempted circumnavigation of Greenland.
sentences.chinese: 他参加了环绕格林兰的试航。

sentences.english: Amid deafening applause, people on the platform went ashore in succession.
sentences.chinese: 在震耳欲聋的鞭炮声中，试航人员依次上岸。

sentences.english: Three days at sea convinced me the double-hull theory was wrong.
sentences.chinese: 在海上试航三天后，我就确信双层船身理论是错误的。

sentences.english: The DHCS shall be delivered at port A after due trial voyage and tests.
sentences.chinese: 深舱货轮经试航和测试后在A港交船。

sentences.english: The first tests on the Solent in 1959 caused a sensation.
sentences.chinese: 1959年于苏伦特海峡的首次试航引起了轰动。

sentences.english: At last, however, the king and queen of Spain gave him ships with which to make the trial voyage.
sentences.chinese: 最终，西班牙国王和王后为他准备了舰船，供他试航。

definition: aircraft carrier/abbr. for 航空母艦|航空母舰[hang2 kong1 mu3 jian4]
aircraft carrier/CL:艘[sou1]/(coll.) (fig.) sth huge/(like) a whale
Liaoning, the first aircraft carrier commissioned into the PLA Navy (commissioned in 2012)
to serve in the army/in active service
downstream/to go into the water/to put into water/to launch (a ship)/fig. to fall into bad ways/to lead astray/to go to pot
